events.event_description: Global refinery margins reached their lowest September levels since 2020, indicating reduced profitability from refining crude oil and selling petroleum products.
events.citation: This year, the September monthly average refinery margin fell to its lowest for the month since 2020, when there was significantly less transportation fuel demand because of pandemic-related reductions in travel.

events.event_description: Kuwait's Al-Zour refinery reached full refining capacity of 615,000 barrels per day.
events.citation: Kuwait's 615,000-barrel-per-day (b/d) Al-Zour refinery reached full refining capacity early in 2024

events.event_description: Oman's Duqm refinery with 230,000 barrels per day capacity began operations.
events.citation: Oman's 230,000-b/d Duqm refinery has begun operations

events.event_description: Nigeria's Dangote refinery with 650,000 barrels per day capacity started ramping up operations.
events.citation: Nigeria's 650,000-b/d Dangote refinery has been ramping up refining activity

events.event_description: LyondellBasell announced plans to close its 264,000 barrel per day refinery in Houston, Texas by Q1 2025.
events.citation: LyondellBasell plans to close its 264,000-b/d refinery in Houston, Texas, by the first quarter of 2025

events.event_description: U.S. distillate fuel oil consumption dropped 6% compared to 2023 and 8% compared to 2019 from June through September 2024.
events.citation: In 2024, U.S. product supplied of distillate fuel oil (the proxy we use for consumption) averaged 6% less than in 2023 and 8% than in 2019 from June through September
